issue.message: Use a functional interface instead of lambda syntax for lambdas with primitive values in method slideIntoContainer has parameter 'initialOffset' with type Function1<? super Integer, Integer>.
Use a functional interface instead of lambda syntax for lambdas with primitive values in method slideOutOfContainer has parameter 'targetOffset' with type Function1<? super Integer, Integer>.
Use a functional interface instead of lambda syntax for lambdas with primitive values in method expandHorizontally has parameter 'initialWidth' with type Function1<? super Integer, Integer>.
Use a functional interface instead of lambda syntax for lambdas with primitive values in method expandVertically has parameter 'initialHeight' with type Function1<? super Integer, Integer>.
Use a functional interface instead of lambda syntax for lambdas with primitive values in method shrinkHorizontally has parameter 'targetWidth' with type Function1<? super Integer, Integer>.
Use a functional interface instead of lambda syntax for lambdas with primitive values in method shrinkVertically has parameter 'targetHeight' with type Function1<? super Integer, Integer>.
Use a functional interface instead of lambda syntax for lambdas with primitive values in method slideInHorizontally has parameter 'initialOffsetX' with type Function1<? super Integer, Integer>.
Use a functional interface instead of lambda syntax for lambdas with primitive values in method slideInVertically has parameter 'initialOffsetY' with type Function1<? super Integer, Integer>.
Use a functional interface instead of lambda syntax for lambdas with primitive values in method slideOutHorizontally has parameter 'targetOffsetX' with type Function1<? super Integer, Integer>.
Use a functional interface instead of lambda syntax for lambdas with primitive values in method slideOutVertically has parameter 'targetOffsetY' with type Function1<? super Integer, Integer>.
